item.description:
Since 1993, the Stroll has served as Nashua’s official kick-off to the holiday season. Each year, close to 30,000 people from across New England visit downtown Nashua to enjoy this FREE holiday event.

The evening kicks off with a candlelit walk of thousands down to Railroad Square where the City's official Christmas tree is lit. Much of the downtown is closed to traffic for the evening, allowing Strollers to wander to different artistic and cultural performances, sample offerings from street vendors, dine in downtown’s fine restaurants and do holiday shopping at our unique specialty shops and boutiques.

Entertainment -

Over 25 venues will host a variety of performers this year in addition to the costumed characters and entertainers on the street. Program guide to be posted on website by November 6th.

Food -

New this year! Several of your favorite downtown restaurants will be serving menu items outside in front of their restaurant. Try food from Fody's Tavern, Saffron Bistro, Thousand Crane, Unums, Stella Blu, Black Orchid Grille, Vietnam Noodle House, San Francisco Kitchen, Michael Timothy's, Surf, and The Sausage King and Villa Banca.

Raffle -

Win tickets to Chunky's Cinema & Pub, gift certicates to downtown shops and restaurants, hotel stays ski/snowboarding packages and more! Raffle tickets can be purchased before the event at: Great American Downtown, located at 92 Main St., Ste. 101 or at these downtown locations (locations coming soon) Tickets are $1/each or buy a book of 6 for only $5. Tickets can also be purchased on the night of the event at 2 different raffle booths right on Main St.

Beer Garden -

New this year! The beer garden has moved! It will be located on High St. (next to Scontsas Fine Jewelry & Home Decor). All ages welcome -- however wristbands are required for those 21 years or older who would like to purchase beer (valid ID required). Join us at the beer garden from 5pm-10pm.

http://www.downtownna...
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet in front of the library.
item.name: 16th Annual Winter Holiday Stroll
